intro: Siphocampylus dentatus, commonly known as the toothed siphocampylus, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats. Siphocampylus dentatus is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
